fields.physical_description:
The figure represents a woman with a child standing in front of it. It is simply carved and partly painted in ochre and brown; together with red and blue-black designs representing floral patterns and single flowers on the head dress and dress. Around the neckline are dots of these two colours with matching stripes on the sleeves. Around the woman's neck is painted a dark pink ribbon and bow. The facial features are indicated by two pink cheek dots; black dot eyes and a red mouth. The child figure is not separately painted. The figure appears to be standing on a block and it is flat at the back with a high semi-circular head dress. 
*This is a symbolic doll type showing the protection and comfort given by the adult to the child - a symbol of protection not necessarily simply between adults and children but between people and people and animals. 
A N Varganov is a well known and internationally known maker of these toys. His work is represented in other museums in the USA; Australia; Japan and Germany. He comes from a traditional craft family making these types of toys; both wooden and papier maché; from before 1900.
fields.title: NANNY AND CHILD; (Veduchka)
fields.materials_techniques: hand carved limewood; partly painted and varnished
fields.history_note:
References: RUSSIAN FOLK TOYS booklet published by the Museum of Toys; USSR
Academy of Pedagogical Sciences. see also registered packet

Collection was presented to BGM by the Traditional Sergiev Cultures Centre; following an exhibition at the Cambridge Folk Museum; September 1994. The items are modern; made to the traditional designs and methods by craftsmen whose families had produced the toys before 1900.

Price: £10.00
fields.production_note:
Made by: A N Varganov of Sergiev Posad.
Russia
